For a positive integer $n,$ simplify
\[1^2 - 2^2 + 3^2 - 4^2 + \dots + (2n - 1)^2 - (2n)^2.\]
inference:
We have
\begin{align*} &1^2 - 2^2 + 3^2 - 4^2 + \dots + (2n - 1)^2 - (2n)^2 \\ &= (1^2 - 2^2) + (3^2 - 4^2) + \dots + ((2n - 1)^2 - (2n)^2) \\ &= (1 - 2)(1 + 2) + (3 - 4)(3 + 4) + \dots + ((2n - 1) - (2n))((2n - 1) + (2n)) \\ &= (-1)(3) + (-1)(7) + \dots + (-1)(4n - 1) \\ &= -(3 + 7 + \dots + (4n - 1)).\end{align*} The terms are $3, 7, 11, \dots, 4n - 1,$ which form an arithmetic sequence with first term $a_1 = 3$ and common difference $d = 4.$
The number of terms is $n.$ The $n$th term is given by $a_n = a_1 + (n - 1)d = 3 + (n - 1)(4) = 3 + 4n - 4 = 4n - 1.$
The sum of the arithmetic series is
\begin{align*} \sum_{k=1}^n (4k - 1) &= \sum_{k=1}^n 4k - \sum_{k=1}^n 1 \\ &= 4 \sum_{k=1}^n k - \sum_{k=1}^n 1 \\ &= 4 \cdot \frac{n(n + 1)}{2} - n \\ &= 2n(n + 1) - n \\ &= 2n^2 + 2n - n \\ &= 2n^2 + n. \end{align*}Therefore, the given sum is
\[-(3 + 7 + \dots + (4n - 1)) = - (2n^2 + n) = -2n^2 - n.\]
Final Answer: $\boxed{-2n^2-n}$
